description: Borrowed from Hindi आबकार (ābkār), from Persian آبکار‎ (âbkâr), from آب‎ (âb, “water”) (from Middle Persian ʾp̄ (āp, “water”), from Old Persian āpi-, akin to Avestan 𐬁𐬟𐬱‎ (āfš, “water”), Sanskrit अप् (ap, “water”), Lithuanian ùpė, Old Prussian appi (“river”)) + کار‎ (kâr, “does”), akin to Sanskrit कर (kara, “doing, giving, effecting”).

entries.meaning: (India) A wine seller; one who is subject to the abkari tax.
